Thomas SMETS wrote:

> Hi,
> I'm currently testing a Class behavior onto which the
> Factory (getInstance(param1, param2, ...)) is playing a crucial role.
> That is the class has some sort of a Singelton pattern where existing
> reference for the singelton factory are used to determine if a reference to
> a particula instance already exists.
>
> I therefore would need to regerister the class to have the static
> variablebeing re-initialized. I there something in Java ?
>

Hi Thomas,

Depending on the implementation of the singleton you're attempting to test, it
may be possible to obtain a reference to its sole instance (or instances) and
assign it a null value.  If the implementation uses lazy initialization, this
may trigger reinitialization on the next invocation of getInstance().

If you haven't already read J.B. Rainsberger's article on the use and
testability of singletons, I highly recommend it:

    http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/webservices/library/co-single.html

In general, singletons are often overused and can be difficult to test, and
J.B.'s article offers some practical alternatives.

Regards,

Mike
